chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
S: Type
T: Type
hs: S
ht: T
s: seq S
t: seq T

Goal:
zip (hs :: s) (ht :: t) = (hs, ht) :: zip s t

Premises:
Notation seq := list
zip = fun S T : Type => fix zip (s : seq S) (t : seq T) {struct t} : seq (S * T) := match s with | [::] => [::] | x :: s' => match t with | [::] => [::] | y :: t' => (x, y) :: zip s' t' end end : forall S T : Type, seq S -> seq T -> seq (S * T) Arguments S, T are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope seq_scope seq_scope]
rev_zip : forall (S T : Type) (s : seq S) (t : seq T), size s = size t -> rev (zip s t) = zip (rev s) (rev t)
zip_unzip : forall (S T : Type) (s : seq (S * T)), zip (unzip1 s) (unzip2 s) = s
zip_cat : forall (S T : Type) (s1 s2 : seq S) (t1 t2 : seq T), size s1 = size t1 -> zip (s1 ++ s2) (t1 ++ t2) = zip s1 t1 ++ zip s2 t2
zip_rcons : forall (S T : Type) (s : seq S) (t : seq T) (x : S) (y : T), size s = size t -> zip (rcons s x) (rcons t y) = rcons (zip s t) (x, y)
rcons_cons : forall (T : Type) (x : T) (s : seq T) (z : T), rcons (x :: s) z = x :: rcons s z
all2E : forall (S T : Type) (r : S -> T -> bool) (s : seq S) (t : seq T), all2 r s t = eqtype.eq_op (size s) (size t) && all (pred_of_simpl (T:=S * T) (SimplPred (fun xy : S * T => r (fst xy) (snd xy)))) (zip s t)
lastI : forall (T : Type) (x : T) (s : seq T), x :: s = rcons (seq.belast x s) (last x s)
rot1_cons : forall (T : Type) (x : T) (s : seq T), rot 1 (x :: s) = rcons s x
unzip1_zip : forall (S T : Type) (s : seq S) (t : seq T), ssrnat.leq (size s) (size t) -> unzip1 (zip s t) = s
rev_cons : forall (T : Type) (x : T) (s : seq T), rev (x :: s) = rcons (rev s) x
size1_zip : forall (S T : Type) (s : seq S) (t : seq T), ssrnat.leq (size s) (size t) -> size (zip s t) = size s
size_zip : forall (S T : Type) (s : seq S) (t : seq T), size (zip s t) = ssrnat.minn (size s) (size t)
unzip2_zip : forall (S T : Type) (s : seq S) (t : seq T), ssrnat.leq (size t) (size s) -> unzip2 (zip s t) = t
size2_zip : forall (S T : Type) (s : seq S) (t : seq T), ssrnat.leq (size t) (size s) -> size (zip s t) = size t
drop_nth : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (n : nat) (s : seq T), ssrnat.leq (Datatypes.S n) (size s) -> drop n s = nth x0 s n :: drop (Datatypes.S n) s
perm_consP : reflect (exists (i : nat) (u : seq (eqtype.Equality.sort ?T)), rot i ?t = ?x :: u /\ perm_eq u ?s) (perm_eq ?t (?x :: ?s)) where ?T : [S : Type T : Type hs : S ht : T s : seq S t : seq T |- eqtype.Equality.type] ?x : [S : Type T : Type hs : S ht : T s : seq S t : seq T |- eqtype.Equality.sort ?T] ?s : [S : Type T : Type hs : S ht : T s : seq S t : seq T |- seq (eqtype.Equality.sort ?T)] ?t : [S : Type T : Type hs : S ht : T s : seq S t : seq T |- seq (eqtype.Equality.sort ?T)]
all2 = fun S T : Type => fix all2 (r : S -> T -> bool) (s : seq S) (t : seq T) {struct s} : bool := match s with | [::] => match t with | [::] => true | _ :: _ => false end | x :: s0 => match t with | [::] => false | y :: t0 => r x y && all2 r s0 t0 end end : forall S T : Type, (S -> T -> bool) -> seq S -> seq T -> bool Arguments S, T are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope function_scope seq_scope seq_scope]
seq_ind2 : forall P : seq ?S -> seq ?T -> Type, P [::] [::] -> (forall (x : ?S) (y : ?T) (s0 : seq ?S) (t0 : seq ?T), size s0 = size t0 -> P s0 t0 -> P (x :: s0) (y :: t0)) -> forall (s0 : seq ?S) (t0 : seq ?T), size s0 = size t0 -> P s0 t0 where ?S : [S : Type T : Type hs : S ht : T s : seq S t : seq T |- Type] ?T : [S : Type T : Type hs : S ht : T s : seq S t : seq T |- Type]
cat1s : forall (T : Type) (x : T) (s : seq T), [:: x] ++ s = x :: s
rotr1_rcons : forall (T : Type) (x : T) (s : seq T), rotr 1 (rcons s x) = x :: s
rev_rcons : forall (T : Type) (s : seq T) (x : T), rev (rcons s x) = x :: rev s
headI : forall (T : Type) (s : seq T) (x : T), rcons s x = head x s :: behead (rcons s x)
belast_rcons : forall (T : Type) (x : T) (s : seq T) (z : T), seq.belast x (rcons s z) = x :: s
size = fun T : Type => fix size (s : seq T) : nat := match s with | [::] => 0%nat | _ :: s' => S (size s') end : forall T : Type, seq T -> nat Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope seq_scope]
List.app_comm_cons : forall (A : Type) (x y : seq A) (a : A), a :: (x ++ y)%list = ((a :: x)%SEQ ++ y)%list
cat_cons : forall (T : Type) (x : T) (s1 s2 : seq T), (x :: s1) ++ s2 = x :: s1 ++ s2
perm_cons : forall (T : eqtype.Equality.type) (x : eqtype.Equality.sort T) (s1 s2 : seq (eqtype.Equality.sort T)), perm_eq (x :: s1) (x :: s2) = perm_eq s1 s2
List.firstn_cons : forall (A : Type) (n : nat) (a : A) (l : seq A), List.firstn (Datatypes.S n) (a :: l) = a :: List.firstn n l
List.map_cons : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (x : A) (l : seq A), List.map f (x :: l) = f x :: List.map f l
String.list_ascii_of_string_of_list_ascii : forall s : seq Ascii.ascii, String.list_ascii_of_string (String.string_of_list_ascii s) = s
drop = fun T : Type => fix drop (n : nat) (s : seq T) {struct s} : seq T := match s with | [::] => s | _ :: s' => match n with | 0%nat => s | S n' => drop n' s' end end : forall T : Type, nat -> seq T -> seq T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope nat_scope seq_scope]
RotToSpec : forall (T : eqtype.Equality.type) (s : seq (eqtype.Equality.sort T)) (x : eqtype.Equality.sort T) (i : nat) (s' : seq (eqtype.Equality.sort T)), rot i s = x :: s' -> rot_to_spec (T:=T) s x
map_cons : forall (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (x : T1) (s : seq T1), [seq f i | i <- x :: s] = f x :: [seq f i | i <- s]
mem_head : forall (T : eqtype.Equality.type) (x : eqtype.Equality.sort T) (s : seq (eqtype.Equality.sort T)), x \in x :: s
seq.belast = fun T : Type => fix belast (x : T) (s : seq T) {struct s} : seq T := match s with | [::] => [::] | x' :: s' => x :: belast x' s' end : forall T : Type, T -> seq T -> seq T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ seq_scope]
rev_cat : forall (T : Type) (s t : seq T), rev (s ++ t) = rev t ++ rev s
rcons = fun T : Type => fix rcons (s : seq T) (z : T) {struct s} : seq T := match s with | [::] => [:: z] | x :: s' => x :: rcons s' z end : forall T : Type, seq T -> T -> seq T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope seq_scope _]
String.list_ascii_of_string = fix list_ascii_of_string (s : String.string) : seq Ascii.ascii := match s with | String.EmptyString => [::] | String.String ch s0 => ch :: list_ascii_of_string s0 end : String.string -> seq Ascii.ascii Argument scope is [string_scope]
String.string_of_list_ascii = fix string_of_list_ascii (s : seq Ascii.ascii) : String.string := match s with | [::] => String.EmptyString | ch :: s0 => String.String ch (string_of_list_ascii s0) end : seq Ascii.ascii -> String.string Argument scope is [seq_scope]
size_rev : forall (T : Type) (s : seq T), size (rev s) = size s
